item.title: Heidi add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Better to sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunk Christian." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "When I fall in love, it will be forever." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "And it may be that love sometimes occurs without pain or misery." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "It's fear that makes us lose our conscience. It's also what transforms us into cowards." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "He was mastered by the sheer surging of life, the tidal wave of being, the perfect joy of each separate muscle, joint, and sinew in that it was everything that was not death, that it was aglow and rampant, expressing itself in movement, flying exultantly under the stars." -- Jack London

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Julie Otsuka
item.description: "It's all in the way you breathe." -- Julie Otsuka
